Belum Pulih Seratus Persen, Persebaya Tak Mau Paksa Irfan Jaya
05 Nov 2019, 19:27 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Pelatih Persebaya Surabaya, Aji Santoso tidak mau memaksakan Irfan Jaya untuk bermain ketika menghadapi PS Tira Persikabo. Sebab, kondisinya belum sepenuhnya pulih setelah mengalami cedera pada engkel kirinya.
Irfan juga masih belum berlatih normal dengan tim. Winger asal Bantaeng tersebut masih berlatih di pinggir lapangan.
Menurut Aji, dirinya memang memberi kebebasan kepada Irfan Jaya untuk memulihkan kondisinya terlebih dahulu. Dia tidak masalah meski harus kehilangan Irfan, karena itu dinilai lebih baik.
"Karena saya takut kan ketika dia belum selesai seratus persen, cederanya saya paksa, dia mainnya tidak maksimal, mainnya enggak bagus," jelas Aji, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Selain itu, jika dipaksakan, tentu Irfan akan butuh waktu yang lebih panjang untuk memulihkan kondisinya. Situasi seperti itu jutsru akan merugikan tim karena bisa kehilangan Irfan lebih lama.
"Untuk itu, dari pada berlarut-larut, mending saya kehilangan satu pertandingan, tapi sisa pertandingan dia bisa main," tegas Aji.

Not to Recover One Hundred Percent, Persebaya Doesn't Want to Forced Irfan Jaya
05 Nov 2019, 19:27 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Persebaya Surabaya coach, Aji Santoso does not want to force Irfan Jaya to play when facing PS Tira Persikabo. Because, his condition has not fully recovered after suffering an injury to his left ankle.
Irfan also hasn't trained normally with the team. The winger from Bantaeng is still practicing on the sidelines.
According to Aji, he indeed gave freedom to Irfan Jaya to restore his condition first. He was not a problem despite having to lose Irfan, because it was considered better.
"Because I am afraid that when he has not finished one hundred percent, my injuries will be forced, he will not play optimally, he will not play well," explained Aji, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
In addition, if forced, of course Irfan will need more time to restore his condition. Such a situation would hurt the team because it could lose Irfan longer.
"For that reason, rather than being protracted, I'd better lose one match, but the rest of the match he could play," said Aji.
